error.header: Report a problem with your new BRP

same-address.header: Is your address still the same as the one your BRP was sent to?

location-applied.header: Where did you make your application?
location-applied.subheader: Tell us if the application was made in the UK or overseas

lost.header: Report a lost or stolen BRP

personal-details.subheader: We need these details to cancel your lost or stolen BRP.

contact-details.header: Where can we contact you to tell you what to do next?

delivery.header: My BRP has not been delivered

personal-details.subheader: We need these details to find out what has happened to your BRP.

same-address.header: Is your address still the same as the one on the letter from the Home Office?

reasons.header: Why couldn't you collect your BRP?
reasons.subheader: Tell us the reason why you were unable to collect the BRP.

where.header: From where were you asked to collect your BRP?
where.description: This could have been from a Post Office or a sponsor, such as your legal representative, employer, university or school.
where.date-question: When did you try to collect your BRP? (optional)

about-error.header: Whatâ€™s the problem with your BRP?
about-error.subheader: You can select one or more problems

contact-details.header: Where can we contact you to let you know about your BRP?

address.title: Tell us your address so that we can contact you by post.

uk-address.header: Do you have an UK address where we can send the card?

address.title: If needed, we will send a correct BRP to this address.

same-address.header: Did you expect your BRP to be delivered to the same address as the one on the letter from the Home Office?

address.title: Tell us the new address and we will organise another delivery.

personal-details.subheader: We need these details to review the problem with your BRP.

check-details.header: Is the information you have given us correct?
check-details.subheader: Check and make sure the information below is right. If it isn't you can change it here.

org-help.title: Has an organisation filled in this information on your behalf?
org-help.explanation: This could be an immigration lawyer or representative, or a charity, employer, college or university.

footer.title: Send us your details
footer.explanation: By sending us your details you confirm that the information you have provided is true and that you accept our terms and conditions.

check-details-error.header: Is the information you have given us correct?
check-details-error.subheader: Check and make sure the information below is right. If it isn't you can change it here.

date-lost.header: When did you realise you no longer had your BRP?

confirmation.header: Thank you, we have received your information.
confirmation.privacy: We keep your personal data secure according to our privacy policy.
confirmation.email: We have sent you an email containing the information you have provided to

para.one: We will now review the information you have sent us and we will let you know if you need a new card.
para.two: We will get back to you within 5 working days. For example, if you contact us on a Monday you will hear back by the following Monday.
para.three: We will then advise you what to do next.

para.one: You should hear from us in the next working day, We will tell you if you need to apply for a replacement BRP.
We will contact you in the next working day to tell you what to do.
para.two: As you are outside the UK, you may need to apply for a temporary visa to get back to the UK.
para.three: We will tell you if you need to apply for a temporary visa when we contact you.

letter-received.header: Have you received a letter from the Home Office?

list.one: your application to stay in the UK was successful
list.two: your biometric residence permit (BRP) is going to be delivered

letter-received.date-question: What is the date on the letter?

para.one: If you haven't received a letter from the Home Office about your application to remain in the UK it may mean a decision hasn't been made yet.

on-the-way.header: Your biometric residence permit should be on the way

one.second: working days since the letter from the Home Office letter saying your application to remain in the UK was successful.

two.second: working days, and if you still have not received your card, use this form to contact us.

conditions-and-length.header: Information about leave to remain in the UK

para.one: As you think the conditions or length of your leave are incorrect you must apply for administrative review, where this will be considered.

truncated.header: Problems with names on your BRP

parts.three: letters. Your BRP can only show a maximum of 30 letters, so it is shortened to this on your BRP:

parts.one: Is this how it looks on your BRP?

paras.one: Your name has been shortened on your BRP, as a maximum of 30 characters can be printed on the card.
paras.two: This is not an error. The information is correct on your card and you will be able to use it to travel.
paras.three: You do not need to do anything else.

default.title: Sorry, something went wrong
default.message: A server exception occurred. Please try again.

session.title: Sorry, you'll have to start again
session.message: You haven't entered any details for 20 minutes, so we have cleared your information to keep it secure.
